name: Custom Menus Background Image (WOW) - Dark / Black
description:
Allows you to Customize the menu background image of ALL menus for Dark (Black) Themes.
	Increases menu navigation and readability, as well as adding a fun-theming image to your browser.
This style supports Firefox3.
This is a fun style so you can customize the background, using any image or color scheme.

** Modification of style 4007 by user 4479, and style 85 by user 12.  My style is entirely based on this code!!

Functions:
- Background image will be a faded Black Firefox logo.
- Text color of the menu will be changed to white.

Code Provided Performs the following:
- Color of menus by default for this theme will be Black (easy to change)
- Bold text will be Disabled
- Disabled menu items are gray
- Text color of white
- Background is Black
- Menu color Black too.

NOTE: This style is the OPPOSITE of Style 8028.
This style was suggested to me by Desi911... Thanks everyone for the feedback.  I am pleased to create custom styles from your feedback!
Works best on dark themes.

Applies to:
- File, Edit, View, History, Bookmarks, Tools and Help menus
- Navigation Toolbar (example: right clicking on back button)
- Main Context Menu (Right clicking on any web page)
- Right-Clicking on a tab
- Right-Clicking on the Location Bar (address bar)
- Also Applies to EVERY single menu on any window of a popup or pane

Browser Versions:
- Works on Firefox 3
- Works on SeaMonkey

Additional Information:
* Make sure you don't use a menu-color that conflicts with your image.  This is a warning, as this is an almost global UI style, so don't complain in the ratings, just choose a good color / picture combo!
* You may have to disable some of my other styles for this style to look right.
+ This style has been tested on Multiple Themes! Including NASA Night Launch, NASA Normal, and the Default Firefox 3 Theme.  It has worked perfectly on each.

Also Try:
+ Style 9864

About:Screenshots:
 The screenshots' heights are different because:
- Before was taken in Firefox 3 Default Theme
- After was taken in NASA Night Launch

Changelog:
1.0.0.2:
+ Added Separator color - Gray
+ Added Border of menus color - Gray
+ Added new After Image to reflect recent changes
* New Features suggested by FallenÂ§Angel on the UserStyles Forums - Thanks!

1.0.0.1:
+ Made Background Image a bit brighter, more catchy and better looking.
+ Updated Style After-Image to newest change.
css:
/*
 _______________________________________________________________________
|                  |                                                    |
|          Title:  |  Custom Menus Background Image (WOW) - DARK /Black |
|    Description:  |  Custom background for all menus, for black themes |
|         Author:  |  -=Ben=-                                           |
|   Date Created:  |  June 24, 2008                                     |
|   Last Updated:  |  June 24, 2008                                     |
|        Version:  |  1.0.0.1                                           |
|__________________|____________________________________________________|

*/


@namespace url(http://www.mozilla.org/keymaster/gatekeeper/there.is.only.xul);






popup:not(#autoscroller), menupopup 
{
  background-image: url(data:image/png;base64,) !important;
  background-color: #000000 !important;
  color: #FFFFFF !important;
  background-position: center center !important;
  background-repeat: no-repeat !important;
  background-attachment: scroll !important;
  border-color: #AAAAAA !important;
}


menubar > menu, menupopup > menu, popup > menu, menuitem, toolbarbutton,popup:not(#autoscroller)
{ 
  color: #FFFFFF !important; 
}

/* NEW CODE - Menu Seperator: */
menuseparator
{
  border-color: #AAAAAA !important;
  color: #AAAAAA !important;
}



#contentAreaContextMenu menuitem[disabled="true"],
#contentAreaContextMenu menuitem[disabled="true"] + menuseparator,
menuitem[disabled="true"]
{ 
  /*display: none !important; */
  color:#aaaaaa !important;
}



menupopup > menu[_moz-menuactive="true"],
menupopup > menuitem[_moz-menuactive="true"],
popup > menu[_moz-menuactive="true"],
popup > menuitem[_moz-menuactive="true"] 
{
  color: #FFFFFF !important;  
}
